extendedInfo.description: Time tracking is simple and easy with HoursTracker, the Android version of the best time tracker on iOS.  Keep track of your time and earnings at your hourly job, or track time as a contractor or freelancer.  Use it like a punch clock; start a timer with only two quick taps.  Or, record your time by entering your punch times manually.  View your earnings (even overtime!) and pay periods in the app, or export your time card via e-mail in text or CSV format and work with it however you need to.Other time tracking apps are slow, complex, and clunky.  HoursTracker is super responsive and features a modern and intuitive pure Android user interface with support for gestures such as swipe between tabs, and long-press actions.FEATURESâ Track your time while you use other apps (or even power off your phone!) without HoursTracker being active in the background.  No extra drain on your battery.â Add as many jobs as you need, thereâs no limit.*â Track your time in real-time by clocking in/out while you work.  Watch as time and earnings accumulate by the minute.â Already working but forgot to clock in?  No problem, use âStart Clock At...â and start counting time from when you started work.â Be alerted when you've worked your expected daily hours. Just set the "time per day" for your jobs, then clock in/out like always. You'll also see a neat visual representation of how much work time is left in your day.  Even takes time rounding into account!â Enter time manually -- just choose a start date/time and an end date/time or just a duration.  Add comments, change the hourly rate for that entry to account for pay differentials, easily subtract breaks, and apply pre-defined tags to help categorize your entries.*â View your time and earnings by day, or by calendar week or month on the Entries tab.â Choose between weekly, bi-weekly, semi-monthly, or monthly pay period styles for each job and view your time by pay period on the Pay Periods tab.  Enter an estimated tax percentage and per-pay period deductions and HoursTracker will even display net earnings estimates.â Assign a pay rate and HoursTracker will calculate your earnings, even taking overtime into account.â Track your daily and weekly overtime earnings with two rates for each.  If you get paid time and a half over 8 hours and double-time over 12 hours or by the week (or both!), HoursTracker has you covered.â Clock in to any number of jobs at a time, or set it up to have only one timer running at a time automatically.  Just clock in to another job and the current one automatically clocks out.â Flexible rounding options automatically round your time worked and can be configured per-job.  If you round up to 1/10th of an hour, or just want to match your time clock's 15 minute rounding, HoursTracker can do it automatically.â Export time sheet data via e-mail in text or CSV formats in the message body or attachment.  Export all jobs, or any selection of jobs, for all-time or between any two dates.  Combine all entries into one daily summary, or export each one including the clock in / out times.â Full edit and delete of jobs and hours worked.  Easily copy a job if a new job will have similar settings.â Date formats and currency symbols respect your deviceâs international settings.* Free version is limited to three jobs and three weeks of time entries at a time.  Give HoursTracker a try, and if you're happy with it, easily upgrade to unlimited jobs and time entries with an In-App purchase.HoursTracker has been the top time tracking app on iOS for over three years and we've re-imagined it for Android.  We're just getting started on Android and have a lot of cool plans for the future.  If you love Hours Tracker please consider writing a review.  Join us at facebook.com/HoursTracker.  For support e-mail AndroidSupport@gmail.com.  Please write to us instead of submitting bugs or questions in a review.

reviews.title: outstanding App
reviews.comment: i have been useing this app for quite a while it keeps accurite time and at the end of my week i send my hours to the boss and thhat is what he pays me. even keeps track when i change time zones.
reviews.author: Paul Curtis

reviews.title: An awesome app
reviews.comment: I love that this app is awesome. I work in the oil field and use this app daily. There is only one thing I do not like is that it wont let you delete previous jobs on the job tab but It will let you delete them on the entry tab.
reviews.author: Jerimie Coffman

reviews.title: Best time tracker available
reviews.comment: This app is the easiest way to keep track of my time and to turn it in to tue office. I\'ve tried many other apps but they dond give the options this one has. So glad you finally got on the android phones
reviews.author: Art Fieser

reviews.title: Possible 5
reviews.comment: This app does its purpose, with the benefit of counting the hours and how much you make every pay period. The only problem is there is no back up! If you fix this, absolute FIVE
reviews.author: Jessica Lopez

reviews.title: Needs a better date/time picker
reviews.comment: It\'s a great app but the date/time picker is atrocious. It\'s decent if you\'re just logging in recent (like just today) shifts, but putting in past shifts results in endless amounts of flicking and scrolling. Can you please implement the new date/time picker from the updated Google calendar app? It would be the final piece of the puzzle for this great tool.
reviews.author: Lashan Ranasinghe

reviews.title: Updated Note
reviews.comment: Emailed developer and he helped me though my issues. A few tweaks will make this 5 star. Add the ability to preset the break time so not to have to always enter the length of the break time each day.
reviews.author: Max Rebos

reviews.title: Best so far
reviews.comment: Based off of others on here this is the best I\'ve sampled, however my job offers 1.5 o/t on Sundays so I wish I had the option to change my base pay to o/t in one job for that \"clock in\" period rather than having to create a whole seperate job at a diff payrate to clock in to.
reviews.author: Stefan Shoup

reviews.title: Favorite app to track work hours
reviews.comment: Used it on my iphone for a long time. Now im using it on my Android
reviews.author: Levon Kinley

reviews.title: Needs GPS
reviews.comment: Please add GPS to this version
reviews.author: Russell Sailors

reviews.title: Most used app on my phone now on Android!
reviews.comment: Amen @JamesBittle!! I have this program on my iPhone and now on my Android too! Being self-employed this app has been a really useful while on customer sites and working from the home office. Great stuff! Thanks for making an Android version too!
reviews.author: Dave Vigliotti

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Great app. Had it on my iPhone 4s and had to it for my Samsung S4
reviews.author: James Bittle
